page.title: 13BIRKDALE TRAIN STATION
page.content: Birkdale station is situated near the edge of the small village.It is easy to get to from most roads in and around Birkdale.It was built in the late eighteen hundreds. When the station was owned by British Rail,the trains ran from the station every half hour in the evening. Recently,the station has been taken over by Mersey Rail.This means that the trains run more often,every ten minutes. The trains consist or six carriages,each containing seventy-two seats There are 22 stations at which the train has to stop,the last one being,Hunts Cross.It takes fifty-five minutes to get there from Birkdale. The cheapest fare is 5 pence for children and ten pence for adults.
